Package men.brakh

Class RailFence

  • java.lang.Object
    • men.brakh.RailFence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cipher
    public class RailFence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cipher
    Class Allows you to encrypt and Ciphertext messages using a cipher "rail-fence" About cipher: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail_fence_cipher
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pankratiew Alexandr

    • Method Detail

      • getTerm

        private int getTerm​(int iteration,
                    int row,
                    int size)
        The method determines at what distance the next symbol is at the same "height".
        Example:
        1 7 13
        2 6 8 12 ...
        3 5 9 11
        4 10
        2,6,8,12 are at the same height, but distance between 2 and 6 = 4 chars, between 6 and 8 = 2
        Method takes this into account
        Parameters:
        iteration - The number of the current character in the line at one "height"
        row - The number of current
        size - The number of rows (key)
        Returns:
        Distance the next symbol is at the same "height"

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode​(java.lang.String message,
                               int key)
        The method encodes messages with a cipher "Rail-Fence" with the specified key.
        Specified by:
        encode in interface Cipher
        Parameters:
        message - Plaintext, which should be encrypted
        key - key (The number of "rails" (rows))
        Returns:
        Encoded message
        See Also:
        getTerm(int, int, int)

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode​(java.lang.String message,
                               int key)
        The method decodes messages with a cipher "Rail-Fence" with the specified key.

        Decode algorithm (example):
        Ciphertext = cgroryytahpp

        At rows it:
        ? ?
        ? ? ? ?
        ? ? ? ?
        ? ?
        characters №0, №1 in a source ciphertext - characters №0 and №0+6 (is obtained by getTerm(int, int, int)) in decoded text I.e. char "c" in ciphertext - char №0 in a decoded string, "g" - №6
        с?????g?????
        characters №2, №3, №4, №5 in a source ciphertext - characters №1 and №1+4, №1+4+2, №1+4+2+4 (is obtained by getTerm(int, int, int)) in decoded text
        I.e. char "r" in ciphertext - char №1 in a decoded string, "o" - №5, ...
        cr???ogr???y
        And so on...
        Specified by:
        decode in interface Cipher
        Parameters:
        message - Ciphertext, width should be decrypted
        key - key (The number of "rails" (rows))
        Returns:
        Decoded message
        See Also:
        getTerm(int, int, int)
